lines.text: Gee Jennie, I'm crazy aboutcha. Why I'd... I'd even marry ya.
That's thoughtful of you.
I'll be seein' ya around. Don't do anything while I'm gone that you couldn't do on a bicycle.
What's the hurry? Surprised to see me?
Why Mitch, you old son of a gun. How are ya? It makes it seem like old times to see you around here. Glad to see ya.
Yeah, I'll bet you are.
Uh, Buck said you wanna see me about something?
Yeah.
Well it it's about Buck's joint, I just fixed up the old lady.
I ain't worried about the joint, you dirty double-crossing little rat.
Why, what's the matter?
You know what's the matter. Fred's been peddling my hooch and you're in with them. And you brought in with money that you got from me!
Oh, it's a lie. I ain't had nothing to do with Freddy.
No? Well, I got it straight, and I'm putting the finger on you now.
No, Mitch. I'm honest, I didn't.
Something's gonna happen to you.
No, no, Mitch.
Nobody's gonna peddle hooch around this part but me.
No, but I'm warning you. I got a gun too.
Yeah, but you dirty little...
Please don't, I'm asking you. Please don't, I'm telling you now. I'm asking you...

[Barking]
Real Coney Island hot dogs! They're all pedigree and they're all housebroken!

where you can, drink and be merry all for a dime! Just one thin dime, folks! And you get to see these gorgeous, beautiful women. Give 'em a quick flash girls. Give 'em a quick flash. How do you like that? Now, come closer, come closer.
I suppose you've got the trembles for that Jennie dame?
I've heard rumors to that effect.
I was out with nobody, I tell ya!
Then, where was you?
I-I went to a Turkish bath.
Where was you tomcattin' last night? Come on, think fast, think fast!
I wasn't tomcattin' no place.
Was you out with that floozy?
I don't know what you're talkin' about.
Oh, gee, I couldn't let a dame do a thing like that for me.
There's a couple of busted machines - back in the joint there. Joe'll show 'em to ya. See what you can do with 'em.
Just give me a hairpin.
Hairpin?
Sure. I'm like a dame that way. I can do anything with a hairpin.
Gee, but he's a swell guy.
What's the rap this time?
A handful of clouds.
[Gestures like he is using a handgun]
Puff! Puff! Puff!
You don't mean me! I got an alibi.
Ya, that's what the Chief wants to talk about.
Gee, I hope this don't get Harry Delano in dutch.
It'll kill his old woman if she finds out he's mixed up in the booze racket!

[Angel makes a pass]
Hey, slow down!
Gee, but you're skittish tonight.
Better be or you get hurt.
Hey, we better be gettin' back. Ma will be down here with a lantern and a tomahawk.
Okay, Pocahontas!
He's a no good egg anyway.
You're right, baby.
Well, so long, honey, I'm leavin'.
I thought we might go down and get... a bowl of chop suey.
Can't make it tonight, honey.
No? Why all the glad rags?
I've got a sick girl friend, promised I'd drop over.
Oh, all that for a sick girl friend? Don't give me that bull. You're goin' to the jazz joint with that Harry Delano.
Happy!
I'm wise. I was tipped off you were with him the night before last when you said you had a headache.
Now, sugar, you don't think I'd fall for Harry Delano?
No! You'd fall for anybody that'd spend jack on ya.
Well, he ain't got no jack. He ain't even workin'.
He ain't workin'; but, he's peddlin' booze.
You know, I almost like you.
Well, now that's a great help. Say, I ain't a bad guy. You know how it is. You can get used to anything.
[Tries to make a pass]
Keep your temperature down! I got no intention of gettin' used to ya.
How was Mitch's party last night?
Great! Say, was that some party. A real high class affair. I never saw so many drunken dames in all of my life.
Did you do yourself any good?
Not me, baby. When a dame falls for me, I want to know what she's falling about.
Not a bad idea.
Say, you wouldn't fool a poor old blind man, would ya, lady?
You're a swell prune, you are! Stood me up last night, didn't ya? I parked outside that dump last night until I thought my feet had grown to the sidewalk.
You wouldn't want to see me take a rap, would ya? I'll make it right with you, Myrtle, I'll give you anything you want! Anything up to a grand.
You've never seen that much money.
Well, why not? I'm makin' plenty of dough in the booze racket, ain't i?
What are you gaping at?
Was I gapin'?
Thanks, baby, thanks.
Okay. Anything you say, honey girl.
Come on, Angel, come along.
All right, baby.
That mug in there had it comin' to him!
Oh, you cold hearted old buzzard, let me tell you something.
This place is closed until this thing is settled!
What am I gonna do with all my weenies?
Eat 'em yourself!
Better lie down, Harry, you look all in.
I don't wanna lie down!
And you oughtin' a smoke so many of them cigarettes, either.
Ah, go chase yourself!
Say, you don't think that I handed Mitch that handful of clouds, do ya?
You two have been mushin' it up around here.
Harry, I want to talk to you. You was out neckin' with that Mrytle again last night, wasn't ya?
So, what of it?
I don't want you runnin' around with that gutter floozy!
Shut up you old bat! You ain't runnin' this show.

[to Harry]
What do you say, baby?
Don't you call him baby! Don't you dare! I'm the only one that can call him that!
Who cares a hang about Angel?
Just exactly what are you lookin' for?
Nothing!
I hope you find it.
Ah, cheer up, kid. What'd she say?
She told me to go away and take you with me.
That means you won't get a cent of her jack! And if she's worth what Joe thinks she is, you're passing up about thirty grand.
Here's flatfoot.
[Detective Sikes arrives]
Were you on the sand with Harry?
Think of your reputation!
You think of it. You do more worryin' about it than I do.
Here, Angel. Come on, get busy. The customers is comin'. Remember what I've always said, "Never give a sucker an even break!"
You said it, mother!
